intro: Wrightia natalensis, commonly known as Natal woodbine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Wrightia natalensis is often found in woodland and forested areas, where it thrives in partial shade.
